principle_description: Making unpopular decisions when it serves the long-term mission
question: Tell me about a time when you had to make an unpopular decision that you believed was in the best interest of the company's long-term goals, even though it faced resistance from your team or stakeholders.
quote: Does this help us achieve our mission? is one of the most common questions they ask themselves at Coinbase.

principle_description: Continuous customer feedback and rapid iteration
question: Tell me about a time when you had to iterate on a product or solution multiple times based on customer feedback, and how you balanced speed with quality.
quote: Talk to the customer, iterate, talk to the customer, iterate.
source: Brian Armstrong, CEO, Tim Ferriss Show, 2022

principle_description: Focusing on key messages and clear communication
question: Tell me about a time when you had to communicate a complex vision or strategy to your organization, and how you ensured the core message resonated across different audiences.
quote: You have the opportunity to stick only a few key messages in people's heads about what you're trying to achieve in the world.

principle_description: Complete ownership of achieving the mission
question: Tell me about a time when you took responsibility for a problem that wasn't explicitly part of your job description because you saw it was important for the team's success.
quote: We take 100% responsibility for achieving the mission. We seek to improve all aspects of our company even in ways that are not explicitly part of our job.

principle_description: Deep understanding of others' perspectives and incentives
question: Tell me about a time when you had to solve a complex problem by first understanding the motivations and perspectives of all stakeholders involved.
quote: Two things that I think have served me well are really deep thinking about what is going on in the mind of the other person and what kind of incentives have been created.
source: Stewart Butterfield, CEO, Thought Economics Interview, 2020

principle_description: Using rigorous analysis and clear thinking to address challenges
question: Tell me about a time when you approached a business challenge using first-principles thinking or philosophical reasoning rather than conventional industry practices.
quote: There will always be a demand for understanding human beings.
source: Stewart Butterfield, CEO, Stanford Graduate School of Business, 2019

principle_description: Creating culture where problems are openly discussed
question: Tell me about a time when you proactively brought up a significant problem or challenge to leadership, and how you presented both the issue and potential solutions.
quote: I prefer to start board meetings by discussing what's not going well... because I believe that we can do something about them.

principle_description: Encouraging ownership and ideas from all levels
question: Tell me about a time when you took initiative to lead a project or drive change, even though you weren't in a formal leadership position.
quote: The platform is built on fostering 'leadership from everywhere', where every team member takes ownership of the group's success.

principle_description: Creating inclusive experiences for all users
question: Tell me about a time when you had to design or improve a product or service to be more inclusive and accessible to a diverse group of users.
quote: Our shared vision of belonging is the thread that weaves through every touchpoint on Airbnb.

principle_description: Using design thinking to solve complex problems
question: Tell me about a time when you approached a business problem from a design perspective, focusing on user experience and human-centered solutions.
quote: Good design is not just about looking good; it's about solving problems.
source: Brian Chesky, CEO, Leadership Style Analysis, 2022

principle_description: Building for sustainability over decades
question: Tell me about a time when you had to convince your team to invest in a long-term solution that might not show immediate results but was crucial for future success.
quote: Build a company that can survive for 100 years.

principle_description: Understanding and serving diverse communities
question: Tell me about a time when you had to deeply understand the needs of a community or customer segment that was very different from yourself.
quote: If we want this to be more than just something we put on a plaque, We have to take action.

principle_description: Understanding that identity management is core to security
question: Tell me about a time when you had to convince stakeholders that investing in foundational infrastructure was more important than feature development.
quote: Identity is security. To get security right, you have to get Identity right.

principle_description: Fostering open communication and mutual trust
question: Tell me about a time when you implemented or improved transparency practices in your organization, and how it impacted team performance and trust.
quote: From the beginning, Okta has championed transparency as a core value: facilitating open lines of communication, fostering mutual trust, and uniting the whole company for a common cause.

principle_description: Building solutions based on direct customer input
question: Tell me about a time when you gathered direct feedback from customers to shape a product or service decision, and how that differed from internal assumptions.
quote: The business only exists because Todd McKinnon and Frederic Kerrest spoke with prospects one-on-one to learn what they wanted to see in a cloud identity and security solution.

principle_description: Ensuring every employee has ownership and stake in success
question: Tell me about a time when you helped empower a colleague or team member to take on greater responsibility or ownership of their work.
quote: They want every employee to know that Okta belongs to them, and that they have a stake in their shared wins.
source: Todd McKinnon, CEO, Core Values Update, 2019

principle_description: Acting and thinking like a company owner
question: Tell me about a time when you made a difficult decision about resource allocation or prioritization by thinking about what was best for the company as a whole, not just your immediate team.
quote: Act and think like an owner — which goes a little further than, 'Spend the company's money like you would your own.'

principle_description: Using empathy to understand and serve stakeholders better
question: Tell me about a time when you used empathy to gain a competitive advantage or solve a problem that others couldn't address effectively.
quote: When asked what she'd bring to battle a giant, Jennifer chose empathy as her weapon of choice.
source: Jennifer Tejada, CEO, Unusual VC Interview, 2021

principle_description: Focusing on preventing problems rather than just solving them
question: Tell me about a time when you shifted your team's approach from reactive problem-solving to proactive prevention, and what impact that had.
quote: The goal for us and for our customers is not to just help them respond more effectively when things don't work the way they're supposed to, but to help prevent big issues from happening.

principle_description: Using listening skills to understand and support others
question: Tell me about a time when your active listening skills helped you understand a problem or opportunity that others had missed.
quote: Active listening. You have two ears and one mouth for a reason.

principle_description: Building transportation solutions that strengthen communities
question: Tell me about a time when you designed or improved a product or service to strengthen community connections rather than just individual convenience.
quote: We created a service that was truly peer-to-peer, encouraging customers to sit in the front seat and fist-bump their driver.
source: Logan Green & John Zimmer, Co-founders, Company History, 2015

principle_description: Ensuring alignment of core values in business relationships
question: Tell me about a time when you had to choose between multiple business opportunities or partnerships, and you made the decision based on values alignment rather than just financial benefits.
quote: Alignment of values is incredibly important. Shared values are the single highest priority to align with your Series A investor.

principle_description: Creating solutions that address environmental and social challenges
question: Tell me about a time when you led an initiative that balanced business objectives with environmental or social responsibility.
quote: Lyft strategically invested in a multi-million-dollar carbon-neutral vehicle making environmental conditions safe and habitable giving the company an advantage over its competitors.
source: Logan Green & John Zimmer, Co-founders, Sustainability Strategy, 2021

principle_description: Maintaining conviction despite unfavorable odds
question: Tell me about a time when you persisted with an idea or project that others doubted, because you believed it served an important purpose.
quote: There has to be a burning need to build what you're building. This internal fire is how — in the face of unfavorable odds and intractable challenges — Thunder Lizards find the conviction and endurance to keep going.

principle_description: Designing experiences around visual information processing
question: Tell me about a time when you redesigned a process or product to leverage visual communication instead of text-based approaches.
quote: No amount of technology is going to change the fact that people process information visually.

principle_description: Building technology that reflects human behavior and needs
question: Tell me about a time when you advocated for a more human-centered approach to technology or process design, even when it seemed less efficient.
quote: I want Pinterest to be human. The Internet's still so abstract... To me, boards are a very human way of looking at the world.

principle_description: Focusing on meaningful engagement over rapid expansion
question: Tell me about a time when you chose a slower, more sustainable growth approach over a quick win that could have shown immediate results.
quote: By prioritizing meaningful engagement over rapid expansion, Silbermann built a platform that continues to shape digital inspiration worldwide.

principle_description: Acquiring skills by doing rather than just studying
question: Tell me about a time when you had to learn a new skill or technology on the job to complete a project, and how you approached that learning process.
quote: Don't over-analyze everything. I myself have been guilty of over-thinking problems. Just build things and find out if they work.

principle_description: Creating tools that unlock unlimited creative potential
question: Tell me about a time when you designed or built tools that empowered others to create something beyond what you originally envisioned.
quote: Our vision is to build a human co-experience platform that connects billions of users... the ultimate platform for play.

principle_description: Leveraging collective creativity over individual brilliance
question: Tell me about a time when you chose to build a platform or process that enabled others to innovate, rather than trying to solve everything yourself.
quote: The collective creativity of millions would far surpass what any single company could produce.

principle_description: Focusing on inspiring and empowering users to learn and create
question: Tell me about a time when you shifted your approach from providing solutions to empowering others to create their own solutions.
quote: Roblox is all about inspiring and empowering people to learn, create and explore new ideas.

principle_description: Building environments where people inspire each other
question: Tell me about a time when you created an environment or process that encouraged collaboration and mutual inspiration among team members.
quote: Roblox began with just 100 players and a handful of creators who inspired one another, unlocking this groundswell of creativity, collaboration, and imagination.

principle_description: Building tools that empower developers to focus on innovation
question: Tell me about a time when you designed a tool or system that simplified complex processes for your internal or external users.
quote: Build for developers first. Stripe aims to give developers the tools they need to create the most secure and novel buying experiences.

principle_description: Ensuring solutions work equally well across different markets and regions
question: Tell me about a time when you had to adapt a product or service to work effectively in diverse markets or for underserved populations.
quote: The vision is empowering global participation, not just serving today's needs. He aims for Stripe to work just as well for companies in Nigeria or Brazil as the Western world.

principle_description: Making dependability the primary value proposition
question: Tell me about a time when you prioritized reliability and stability over new features or rapid development, and how you convinced stakeholders this was the right approach.
quote: I now increasingly think of Stripe as we should simply be the most reliable infrastructure partner that people have. And they can always depend on Stripe always working.

principle_description: Making decisions based on long-term vision rather than immediate gains
question: Tell me about a time when you advocated for a long-term solution that required more initial investment but would create better outcomes over time.
quote: Companies have to be willing to make farsighted bets to build breakthrough products versus myopic iteration.
